oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nelson Merry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Teachers at Nelson Merry Training College.

Nelson G. Merry, born a Kentucky slave in 1824, came to Nashville with his master. He was freed on November 1, 1845. Merry became in 1853 the first ordained Negro minister in Nashville. Merry is recognized as a founder of the Tennessee Colored Baptist Association (1866).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Universities & colleges; Education; Teachers
